DeleteResourcePermission.name: DeleteResourcePermission
DeleteResourcePermission.documentation: Removes permissions associated with the target database.

DeregisterApplication.name: DeregisterApplication
DeregisterApplication.documentation: Deregister an SAP application with AWS Systems Manager for SAP. This action does not aï¬€ect the existing setup of your SAP workloads on Amazon EC2.

GetApplication.name: GetApplication
GetApplication.documentation: Gets an application registered with AWS Systems Manager for SAP. It also returns the components of the application.

GetComponent.name: GetComponent
GetComponent.documentation: Gets the component of an application registered with AWS Systems Manager for SAP.

GetConfigurationCheckOperation.name: GetConfigurationCheckOperation
GetConfigurationCheckOperation.documentation: Gets the details of a configuration check operation by specifying the operation ID.

GetDatabase.name: GetDatabase
GetDatabase.documentation: Gets the SAP HANA database of an application registered with AWS Systems Manager for SAP.

GetOperation.name: GetOperation
GetOperation.documentation: Gets the details of an operation by specifying the operation ID.

GetResourcePermission.name: GetResourcePermission
GetResourcePermission.documentation: Gets permissions associated with the target database.

ListApplications.name: ListApplications
ListApplications.documentation: Lists all the applications registered with AWS Systems Manager for SAP.

ListComponents.name: ListComponents
ListComponents.documentation: Lists all the components registered with AWS Systems Manager for SAP.

ListConfigurationCheckDefinitions.name: ListConfigurationCheckDefinitions
ListConfigurationCheckDefinitions.documentation: Lists all configuration check types supported by AWS Systems Manager for SAP.

ListConfigurationCheckOperations.name: ListConfigurationCheckOperations
ListConfigurationCheckOperations.documentation: Lists the configuration check operations performed by AWS Systems Manager for SAP.

ListDatabases.name: ListDatabases
ListDatabases.documentation: Lists the SAP HANA databases of an application registered with AWS Systems Manager for SAP.

ListOperationEvents.name: ListOperationEvents
ListOperationEvents.documentation:
Returns a list of operations events.

Available parameters include OperationID, as well as optional parameters MaxResults, NextToken, and Filters.

ListOperations.name: ListOperations
ListOperations.documentation: Lists the operations performed by AWS Systems Manager for SAP.

ListSubCheckResults.name: ListSubCheckResults
ListSubCheckResults.documentation: Lists the sub-check results of a specified configuration check operation.

ListSubCheckRuleResults.name: ListSubCheckRuleResults
ListSubCheckRuleResults.documentation: Lists the rules of a specified sub-check belonging to a configuration check operation.

ListTagsForResource.name: ListTagsForResource
ListTagsForResource.documentation: Lists all tags on an SAP HANA application and/or database registered with AWS Systems Manager for SAP.

RegisterApplication.name: RegisterApplication
RegisterApplication.documentation:
Register an SAP application with AWS Systems Manager for SAP. You must meet the following requirements before registering.

The SAP application you want to register with AWS Systems Manager for SAP is running on Amazon EC2.

AWS Systems Manager Agent must be setup on an Amazon EC2 instance along with the required IAM permissions.

Amazon EC2 instance(s) must have access to the secrets created in AWS Secrets Manager to manage SAP applications and components.

StartApplication.name: StartApplication
StartApplication.documentation:
Request is an operation which starts an application.

Parameter ApplicationId is required.

StartConfigurationChecks.name: StartConfigurationChecks
StartConfigurationChecks.documentation: Initiates configuration check operations against a specified application.

StopApplication.name: StopApplication
StopApplication.documentation:
Request is an operation to stop an application.

Parameter ApplicationId is required. Parameters StopConnectedEntity and IncludeEc2InstanceShutdown are optional.

TagResource.name: TagResource
TagResource.documentation: Creates tag for a resource by specifying the ARN.

UpdateApplicationSettings.name: UpdateApplicationSettings
UpdateApplicationSettings.documentation: Updates the settings of an application registered with AWS Systems Manager for SAP.

Arn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the application.

AppRegistryArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Application Registry.

DiscoveryStatus.documentation: The latest discovery result for the application.

LastUpdated.documentation: The time at which the application was last updated.

AssociatedApplicationArns.documentation: The Amazon Resource Names of the associated AWS Systems Manager for SAP applications.

Application.documentation: An SAP application registered with AWS Systems Manager for SAP.

DatabaseName.documentation: The name of the SAP HANA database.

SecretId.documentation: The secret ID created in AWS Secrets Manager to store the credentials of the SAP application.

Arn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the application.

ApplicationSummary.documentation: The summary of the SAP application registered with AWS Systems Manager for SAP.

Ec2InstanceId.documentation: The ID of the Amazon EC2 instance.

IpAddresses.documentation: The IP addresses of the associated host.

AssociatedHost.documentation: Describes the properties of the associated host.

BackintConfig.documentation: Configuration parameters for AWS Backint Agent for SAP HANA. You can backup your SAP HANA database with AWS Backup or Amazon S3.

Sid.documentation: The SAP System Identifier of the application component.

SystemNumber.documentation: The SAP system number of the application component.

ParentComponent.documentation: The parent component of a highly available environment. For example, in a highly available SAP on AWS workload, the parent component consists of the entire setup, including the child components.

ChildComponents.documentation: The child components of a highly available environment. For example, in a highly available SAP on AWS workload, the child component consists of the primary and secondar instances.

Status.documentation:
The status of the component.

  • ACTIVATED - this status has been deprecated.

  • STARTING - the component is in the process of being started.

  • STOPPED - the component is not running.

  • STOPPING - the component is in the process of being stopped.

  • RUNNING - the component is running.

  • RUNNING_WITH_ERROR - one or more child component(s) of the parent component is not running. Call GetComponent to review the status of each child component.

  • UNDEFINED - AWS Systems Manager for SAP cannot provide the component status based on the discovered information. Verify your SAP application.

HdbVersion.documentation: The SAP HANA version of the component.

Resilience.documentation: Details of the SAP HANA system replication for the component.

Databases.documentation: The SAP HANA databases of the component.

Hosts.deprecatedMessage: This shape is no longer used. Please use AssociatedHost.

PrimaryHost.deprecatedMessage: This shape is no longer used. Please use AssociatedHost.

DatabaseConnection.documentation: The connection specifications for the database of the component.

LastUpdated.documentation: The time at which the component was last updated.

Arn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the component.

ComponentType.documentation:
This string is the type of the component.

Accepted value is WD.

Sid.documentation:
This string is the SAP System ID of the component.

Accepted values are alphanumeric.

Ec2InstanceId.documentation:
This is the Amazon EC2 instance on which your SAP component is running.

Accepted values are alphanumeric.

ComponentInfo.documentation: This is information about the component of your SAP application, such as Web Dispatcher.

Arn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the component summary.

Id.documentation: The unique identifier of the configuration check.

Description.documentation: A description of what the configuration check validates.

ApplicableApplicationTypes.documentation: The list of SSMSAP application types that this configuration check can be evaluated against.

ConfigurationCheckDefinition.documentation: Represents a configuration check definition supported by AWS Systems Manager for SAP.

Id.documentation: The unique identifier of the configuration check operation.

ApplicationId.documentation: The ID of the application against which the configuration check was performed.

Status.documentation: The current status of the configuration check operation.

StatusMessage.documentation: A message providing additional details about the status of the configuration check operation.

ConfigurationCheckId.documentation: The unique identifier of the configuration check that was performed.

ConfigurationCheckName.documentation: The name of the configuration check that was performed.

ConfigurationCheckDescription.documentation: A description of the configuration check that was performed.

StartTime.documentation: The time at which the configuration check operation started.

EndTime.documentation: The time at which the configuration check operation completed.

RuleStatusCounts.documentation: A summary of all the rule results, showing counts for each status type.

ConfigurationCheckOperation.documentation: Represents a configuration check operation that has been executed against an application.

DatabaseId.documentation: The ID of the SAP HANA database.

Arn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the database.

LastUpdated.documentation: The time at which the database was last updated.

ConnectedComponentArns.documentation: The Amazon Resource Names of the connected AWS Systems Manager for SAP components.

Database.documentation: The SAP HANA database of the application registered with AWS Systems Manager for SAP.

DatabaseArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name of the connected SAP HANA database.

Arn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the database.

ActionType.documentation: Delete or restore the permissions on the target database.

SourceResourceArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the source resource.

ResourceArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the resource.

Policy.documentation: The policy that removes permissions on the target database.

Name.documentation: The name of the filter. Filter names are case-sensitive.

Value.documentation: The filter values. Filter values are case-sensitive. If you specify multiple values for a filter, the values are joined with an OR, and the request returns all results that match any of the specified values

Filter.documentation: A specific result obtained by specifying the name, value, and operator.

ApplicationArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the application.

AppRegistryArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the application registry.

Application.documentation: Returns all of the metadata of an application registered with AWS Systems Manager for SAP.

Component.documentation: The component of an application registered with AWS Systems Manager for SAP.

OperationId.documentation: The ID of the configuration check operation.

ConfigurationCheckOperation.documentation: Returns the details of a configuration check operation.

DatabaseArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the database.

Database.documentation: The SAP HANA database of an application registered with AWS Systems Manager for SAP.

ResourceArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the resource.

HostIp.documentation: The IP address of the Dedicated Host.

InstanceId.documentation: The instance ID of the instance on the Dedicated Host.

Host.documentation: Describes the properties of the Dedicated Host.

AllocationType.documentation: The type of allocation for the IP address.

NextToken.documentation: The token for the next page of results.

MaxResults.documentation: The maximum number of results to return with a single call. To retrieve the remaining results, make another call with the returned nextToken value.

Filters.documentation: The filter of name, value, and operator.

Applications.documentation: The applications registered with AWS Systems Manager for SAP.

NextToken.documentation: The token to use to retrieve the next page of results. This value is null when there are no more results to return.
The token for the next page of results.

MaxResults.documentation:
The maximum number of results to return with a single call. To retrieve the remaining results, make another call with the returned nextToken value.

If you do not specify a value for MaxResults, the request returns 50 items per page by default.

Components.documentation: List of components registered with AWS System Manager for SAP.

NextToken.documentation: The token to use to retrieve the next page of results. This value is null when there are no more results to return.

MaxResults.documentation: The maximum number of results to return with a single call. To retrieve the remaining results, make another call with the returned nextToken value.

NextToken.documentation: The token for the next page of results.

ConfigurationChecks.documentation: The configuration check types supported by AWS Systems Manager for SAP.

NextToken.documentation: The token to use to retrieve the next page of results. This value is null when there are no more results to return.

ListMode.documentation:
The mode for listing configuration check operations. Defaults to "LATEST_PER_CHECK".

  • LATEST_PER_CHECK - Will list the latest configuration check operation per check type.

  • ALL_OPERATIONS - Will list all configuration check operations performed on the application.

MaxResults.documentation: The maximum number of results to return with a single call. To retrieve the remaining results, make another call with the returned nextToken value.

NextToken.documentation: The token for the next page of results.

ConfigurationCheckOperations.documentation: The configuration check operations performed by AWS Systems Manager for SAP.

NextToken.documentation: The token to use to retrieve the next page of results. This value is null when there are no more results to return.
The token for the next page of results.

MaxResults.documentation: The maximum number of results to return with a single call. To retrieve the remaining results, make another call with the returned nextToken value. If you do not specify a value for MaxResults, the request returns 50 items per page by default.

Databases.documentation: The SAP HANA databases of an application.

NextToken.documentation: The token to use to retrieve the next page of results. This value is null when there are no more results to return.

MaxResults.documentation:
The maximum number of results to return with a single call. To retrieve the remaining results, make another call with the returned nextToken value.

If you do not specify a value for MaxResults, the request returns 50 items per page by default.

NextToken.documentation: The token to use to retrieve the next page of results. This value is null when there are no more results to return.

Filters.documentation:
Optionally specify filters to narrow the returned operation event items.

Valid filter names include status, resourceID, and resourceType. The valid operator for all three filters is Equals.

OperationEvents.documentation: A returned list of operation events that meet the filter criteria.

NextToken.documentation: The token to use to retrieve the next page of results. This value is null when there are no more results to return.

MaxResults.documentation: The maximum number of results to return with a single call. To retrieve the remaining results, make another call with the returned nextToken value. If you do not specify a value for MaxResults, the request returns 50 items per page by default.

NextToken.documentation: The token for the next page of results.

Operations.documentation: List of operations performed by AWS Systems Manager for SAP.

NextToken.documentation: The token to use to retrieve the next page of results. This value is null when there are no more results to return.

OperationId.documentation: The ID of the configuration check operation.

MaxResults.documentation: The maximum number of results to return with a single call. To retrieve the remaining results, make another call with the returned nextToken value.

NextToken.documentation: The token for the next page of results.

SubCheckResults.documentation: The sub-check results of a configuration check operation.

NextToken.documentation: The token to use to retrieve the next page of results. This value is null when there are no more results to return.

SubCheckResultId.documentation: The ID of the sub check result.

MaxResults.documentation: The maximum number of results to return with a single call. To retrieve the remaining results, make another call with the returned nextToken value.

NextToken.documentation: The token for the next page of results.

RuleResults.documentation: The rule results of a sub-check belonging to a configuration check operation.

NextToken.documentation: The token to use to retrieve the next page of results. This value is null when there are no more results to return.

resourceArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the resource.

ResourceArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the operation.

LastUpdatedTime.documentation: The time at which the operation was last updated.

Operation.documentation: The operations performed by AWS Systems Manager for SAP.

Description.documentation: A description of the operation event. For example, "Stop the EC2 instance i-abcdefgh987654321".

Resource.documentation:
The resource involved in the operations event.

Contains ResourceArn ARN and ResourceType.

Status.documentation: The status of the operation event. The possible statuses are: IN_PROGRESS, COMPLETED, and FAILED.

StatusMessage.documentation: The status message relating to a specific operation event.

Timestamp.documentation: The timestamp of the specified operation event.

OperationEvent.documentation:
An operation event returns details for an operation, including key milestones which can be used to monitor and track operations in progress.

Operation events contain:

  • Description string

  • Resource, including its ARN and type

  • Status

  • StatusMessage string

  • TimeStamp

Operation event examples include StartApplication or StopApplication.

Instances.documentation: The Amazon EC2 instances on which your SAP application is running.

SapInstanceNumber.documentation: The SAP instance number of the application.

Tags.documentation: The tags to be attached to the SAP application.

DatabaseArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name of the SAP HANA database.

ComponentsInfo.documentation:
This is an optional parameter for component details to which the SAP ABAP application is attached, such as Web Dispatcher.

This is an array of ApplicationComponent objects. You may input 0 to 5 items.

Application.documentation: The application registered with AWS Systems Manager for SAP.

EnqueueReplication.documentation: Indicates if or not enqueue replication is enabled for the ASCS component.

Resilience.documentation: Details of the SAP HANA system replication for the instance.

ResourceArn.documentation:
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the source resource.

Example of ResourceArn: "arn:aws:ec2:us-east-1:111111111111:instance/i-abcdefgh987654321"

Id.documentation: The unique identifier of the rule result.

Description.documentation: A description of what the rule validates.

Message.documentation: A message providing details about the rule result.

Metadata.documentation: Additional metadata associated with the rule result.

RuleResult.documentation: Represents the result of a single rule within a configuration check.

Warning.documentation: The number of rules that returned warnings.

Info.documentation: The number of rules that returned informational results.

Unknown.documentation: The number of rules with unknown status.

RuleStatusCounts.documentation: A summary of rule results, providing counts for each status type.

ConfigurationCheckIds.documentation: The list of configuration checks to perform.

ConfigurationCheckOperations.documentation: The configuration check operations that were started.

StopConnectedEntity.documentation:
Specify the ConnectedEntityType. Accepted type is DBMS.

If this parameter is included, the connected DBMS (Database Management System) will be stopped.

IncludeEc2InstanceShutdown.documentation: Boolean. If included and if set to True, the StopApplication operation will shut down the associated Amazon EC2 instance in addition to the application.

Id.documentation: The unique identifier of the sub-check result.

Description.documentation: A description of what the sub-check validates.

References.documentation: A list of references or documentation links related to the sub-check.

SubCheckResult.documentation: Represents the result of a sub-check within a configuration check operation.

resourceArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the resource.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the resource.

tagKeys.documentation: Adds/updates or removes credentials for applications registered with AWS Systems Manager for SAP.

CredentialsToAddOrUpdate.documentation: The credentials to be added or updated.

Backint.documentation: Installation of AWS Backint Agent for SAP HANA.

DatabaseArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name of the SAP HANA database that replaces the current SAP HANA connection with the SAP_ABAP application.

ValidationException.documentation: The input fails to satisfy the constraints specified by an AWS service.

documentation: This API reference provides descriptions, syntax, and other details about each of the actions and data types for AWS Systems Manager for SAP. The topic for each action shows the API request parameters and responses.
